comment: Amazing professor who wants students to succeed. Use worksheets and Kahoots to prep for the written exam - they're very similar. The online practice exam mirrors the online one. This class isn't an easy A (harder than ACCT 2101 for me), but with effort, success is possible. Highly recommend a study group or attending her help sessions.

Professor Hrinsin is the best accounting professor I've ever had. Her course includes four noncumulative exams—each with an online and in-person portion—and none are dropped. Be sure to complete all homework and take advantage of the extra credit opportunities; the extra credit really helped boost my grade. She's very personable.

Concept vids, hw, quizzes, 4 case studies, and 4 exams. The final wasn't cumulative it was just module 4 exam. Good teacher who cares about her students. Lectures weren't boring and pretty easy to understand, she also posted her lecture vids on D2L. Class wasn't mandatory but she did take attendance and I'd advise you to go. 100% would take again.

I took her spring of '25, and IMO, she's a great professor. What she talks about is exactly on the test, and although attendance isn't mandatory, I learned a lot from her by showing up to the lectures. Her tests are weird because there's an online and an in-person part, but as long as you do the reviews and show up to class, you've got it.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Would 100% recommend Professor Hrinsin! This class was difficult in the beginning, but it got easier as the semester progressed. Attending class is very helpful, she actually teaches instead of just talking about the material. There are four exams and an Excel project that will definitely help your grade. Reaching her is very easy!

Absolutely wonderful professor. I would take her multiple times if I could. Incredibly knowledgeable and truly takes the time to explain each part of her lectures along with practice problems. By far the easiest class I took this semester. Super organized. Overall amazing professor.

Professor Hrinsin is great! Accounting can definitely be a hard class but she makes it a little easier! You have on average 2 assignments a week that are pretty simple and the exams are half online and half in person. She also gives a ton of extra credit which definitely will boost your grade.

Some reviews talk of her negatively, but that is not the case. She knows each student by name, and is incredibly happy to help! She helped me find classes for the fall semester, and even talked to the professor for me! She is an amazing professor and provides many resources to prepare you well for the exam. If you can take her, DO IT!
she's nice and such an amazing professor.

This class wasn't too bad. These accounting classes are hard because there is so much to learn but, if you just do all of the assignments, I don't see how you could fail. There is a ton of assignments which is a blessing and a curse. Her lectures were great, she ran through a ton of examples using excel which was awesome. Do the work, get an A.

Don't let her high rating fool you, as her (4) online tests are not only lockdown with webcam, but you also have to go to a whole different website so a virtual proctor can live monitor you while you take the test. There is weekly homework and quizzes, with deadlines that are not flexible. She's a nice person, but not a good professor.

The worse professor I had at KSU by far! Her lectures make zero sense and she does on problems on an excel sheet which she projects on the board. The exams are nothing like the material she gives in class and are extremely hard. She doesn't like when you ask questions in class and makes jokes when you do. Also gives little to no extra credit.

She is a great professor and her teaching style is really good. She goes over practice problems in class and helps you understand tough concepts whenever you have any questions. The practice exams and study guides are very similar to the real exams and help you prepare very well. There is lots of study material and she is always accessible.

Go to her class she walks you through how to do and understand every concept. She's very sassy and funny, caring, has lots of extra credit opportunities, and tests are quick and very similar to the practices the textbook gives. Take her and you will be thankful.

Good professor not great. She tends to go fast, can be hard if you are not good at accounting. At times she seemed unapproachable. Exams are two parts: online portion with a live proctor, and an in person portion. Tests can be difficult but she has a lot of study material, professor provides everything for students to succeed, homework every week.

She is an amazing accounting professor and I really feel like she provides all the tools necessary to succeed in the class. My only complaint is that she can sometimes come off as judgemental when someone asks a "dumb question", but I don't think it's her intention. Overall I really reccommend her and she cares about her students and their success

I would 100% recommend Professor Hrinsin. She provides students with more than enough study materials, very helpful outside of class as well. The only thing that kind of sucks is the testing format. half is online and proctored and half is in-person pencil and paper. If you attend class, and ask questions you will do well. plus i love her outfits

This professor is one I would recommend. lectures are helpful, she has demo problems for all chapters. her d2l is very organized with a lot of study material. this isn't an easy class so showing up to lectures is important. also the textbook is very helpful for helping you understand concepts you may not get. test are half online half in person

She has good lectures and knows her stuff. Unfortunately, her testing format is absolutely awful. She makes you do half of it online and the other half in person. this leads to you having to do certain problems in different ways; it is incredibly stressful and unclear to figure out what to study. Good lectures but her test format destroyed my GPA.

I took her class online. It was not the best experience but she tried to make it better by being available and giving lots of demo problems. Her online tests have live proctors which is different. I have test anxiety so the structure was not for me.

Prof. Hrinsin really is a God sent. The content is a little difficult, just bc its accounting, but her teaching is above and beyond. Attendance isn't mandatory, but she hands out demo problems that clearly walks through the entire chapter. Very helpful
She also has SO MANY resources online to help with testing, and just to provide extra help. 10/10

Great professor! Gives plenty of practice inside and outside of class and helps guide you through more challenging topics. Offers plenty of supplemental material. Graded by four tests, a few projects, and weekly quizzes, homework, and chapter overviews. If you did not like 2101, she makes the experience much more enjoyable for 2102.

Difficult material, difficult on-paper no-notes exams, did not enjoy. Good professor, engaging lectures where she went over the problems on the board in class and asked for class participation. You will have to take notes and follow along with the practice, and do not get behind!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: She was honestly an amazing professor when it came to being knowledgeable about accounting, but was often very passive-aggressive. going to class is the key to success because of the demo problems that are basically the homework and tests. Tests were taken online or in-person, and doing the extra credit was super useful.

Professor H is awesome! If you need to take 2102, I definitely recommend taking her! Her classtime is comprised of lectures on PowerPoint and walkthroughs of demo problems. Going to class is productive and doesn't feel like a waste of time, and she cares about her students and tries to learn everyone's name. She also posts great resources on D2L.

her exams are half in-person and half online. She changed all the reviews from previously. If accounting is not your thing I would not take this class. I go to class every day and study for hours after class. Accounting 2 is a hard course but I feel that part 1 and part 2 is unnecessary when some people is better taking test online or vise versa.

She is a great professor even though my grade does not reflect it at all (accounting is just not my forte). She is also very caring for her students, in my class of 65 students she made the effort to memorize everyone's name and would greet you as you came into class, not to mention she has a great personality which makes lectures more bearable

I took Acct 2101 not 2102. She is an extremely good teacher with a good personality. Showing up is not mandatory, however it will help a lot as learning accounting by yourself is not fun. Tests have Proctorio but quizzes do not. There is also a lot of extra credit to help cushion your grade. Do not underestimate the class. That is why I have a B.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Best professor I've ever had at KSU. The subject matter is pretty hard if you don't love accounting. She makes it easy if you show up to class and do your homework. A bunch of extra credit that could save you at the end of the semester. TAKE HER for accounting 2 if you want to learn with the best professor!

I love this woman. She made a seriously hard topic easy to understand. There is a lot of homework to do weekly but it actually helps a lot for the test. She gives so much extra credit that I can literally get a 20% on the final and still have an A in the class. Just take her, if I could take her for all my ACCT classes I would.
This teacher was really good. She color coordinates her notes and explains concepts well. Lots of extra credit!!!. One excel project but it was easy. Very understanding teacher, TAKE HER.

Attendance isn't mandatory. Test are either in person or online, you get to choose. They are proctored. A couple of assignments due every Sunday, but they aren't too bad. She is amazing, I would recommend her to anybody.

I loved taking Acct 2102 with Professor Hrinsin! She encourages class participation and answers questions. Attendance is not mandatory and all of her materials are available online. Grading wise, she followed the syllabus all the semester and provided many bonus opportunities. 10/10

Best professor I have had at KSU. She is super involved in making sure students succeed. She makes sure you understand every topic when they get difficult, and is always available outside the classroom. There is four exams with both an in person and online portion however she has TONS of practice tests available to help you do good.

As an accounting major, I appreciate that her lectures focus on teaching you the material instead of just memorizing the concepts. Her lectures were easy to follow and would do problems similar to homework and exam questions. Lots of extra credit opportunities are available in Connect and attending events for Coles. One of the best professors here.

As someone who has struggled with accounting 2101, I did well with her class. It is alot of work but if you complete everything and take advantage of the extra credit, you'll do fine. She is very accessible outside of class and is always willing to help her students. Overall, a very caring professor and passionate about her job.
All homwork, quizzes and tests are on connect. Grade policy is clear. Everyone will do well if they show up for class and do the practice questions before the tests.

She's the best accounting professor ever. We have tableau project and a excel. PLEASE if you are stuck in any lectures or homework, watch the videos that she posts! She's fun and provides extra credit! The exam is taken in class AND online. I'm a accounting major and you won't regret taking this class. Classes aren't mandatory but I suggest going.

Take her!! She knows what she is talking about and lectures are super clear and thorough. She is super nice and is always willing to help explain questions. Attendance isn't mandatory but if you don't go your grade will suffer since the material is hard to self-teach. She makes the material very easy to learn and understand so go to class!!
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Professor Hrinsin is AMAZING! Her lectures are very clear and she explains every step of the process. She is also amazing at answering every student's questions fully. She genuinely cares about her students. Accounting is a hard class but she made it easy. Could not recommend her enough. Best professor at KSU.

She is a great professor. Very easy to understand and does an incredible job teaching the material. She gives extra credit which is really helpful. Her tests are part online with lockdown and the other half in class on paper. Be sure to put in the effort and you will pass with her.

Wow. This lady is pretty great in my opinion. VERY CLEAR study guides and plenty of opportunities to practice the material (unlimited attempts in HW book assignments). The book is clear and the assignments are meaningful. She expects you to work but is accessible and does care about your welfare in the class. I would recommend.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Overall a great professor for accounting. I learned a lot in this class. She goes through excel questions that are related to the chapter. Similar problems are also on the test. Highly recommend.
